jade.story.prob
Class Categorical<T>

java.lang.Object
  jade.story.prob.Categorical<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the support of the distribution
public class Categorical<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a categorical distribution over <T>. This discrete distribution assigns a mass to each possible outcome. This class represents these probabilities a set of frequencies. The probability of any given event is equal to its count divided by the sum of all counts.

Constructor Summary
Categorical()
          Constructs a new categorical distribution with no observed counts.

          Returns a random sample from the categorical distribution using the provided Dice to generate the sampled event.

          Sets the count of the provided key
 int sumCounts()
          Gets the sum of all the counters.
 java.util.Set<T> support()
          Returns the support of the distribution, which is the smallest set whose compliment has a cumulative probability of zero.

support

public java.util.Set<T> support()
Returns the support of the distribution, which is the smallest set whose compliment has a cumulative probability of zero. In other words, it is the set of all elements for which there is a non-zero count.

Returns:
the support of the categorical distribution
